Feature Distance
• SSD is commonly used to measure the difference between two features f1 and f2
• Use ratio-of-distance = SSD(f1, f2) / SSD(f1, f2’) as a measure of reliability of the 
feature match:
◦ f2 is best SSD match to f1 in I2
◦ f2’  is 2nd best SSD match to f1 in I2
◦ Ratio-of-distance is small for ambiguous matches
